psalm.text:
[[Ps 139,1]]O LORD, you have probed me and you know me;
[[Ps 139,2]]you know when I sit and when I stand; 
you understand my thoughts from afar.
[[Ps 139,3]]My journeys and my rest you scrutinize, 
with all my ways you are familiar.

[[Ps 139,4]]Even before a word is on my tongue, 
behold, O LORD, you know the whole of it.
[[Ps 139,5]]Behind me and before, you hem me in 
and rest your hand upon me.
[[Ps 139,6]]Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; 
too lofty for me to attain.

[[Ps 139,7]]Where can I go from your spirit? 
from your presence where can I flee?
[[Ps 139,8]]If I go up to the heavens, you are there; 
if I sink to the nether world, you are present there.

[[Ps 139,9]]If I take the wings of the dawn, 
if I settle at the farthest limits of the sea,
[[Ps 139,10]]even there your hand shall guide me, 
and your right hand hold me fast.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 17,1]]Jesus said to his disciples, "Things that cause sin will inevitably occur, but woe to the person through whom they occur.
[[Lc 17,2]]It would be better for him if a millstone were put around his neck and he be thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
[[Lc 17,3]]Be on your guard! If your brother sins, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.
[[Lc 17,4]]And if he wrongs you seven times in one day and returns to you seven times saying, 'I am sorry,' you should forgive him."
[[Lc 17,5]]And the apostles said to the Lord, "Increase our faith."
[[Lc 17,6]]The Lord replied, "If you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you would say to (this) mulberry tree, 'Be uprooted and planted in the sea,' and it would obey you.

first_reading.text:
[[Sg 1,1]]Love justice, you who judge the earth; think of the LORD in goodness, and seek him in integrity of heart;
[[Sg 1,2]]Because he is found by those who test him not, and he manifests himself to those who do not disbelieve him.
[[Sg 1,3]]For perverse counsels separate a man from God, and his power, put to the proof, rebukes the foolhardy;
[[Sg 1,4]]Because into a soul that plots evil wisdom enters not, nor dwells she in a body under debt of sin.
[[Sg 1,5]]For the holy spirit of discipline flees deceit and withdraws from senseless counsels; and when injustice occurs it is rebuked.
[[Sg 1,6]]For wisdom is a kindly spirit, yet she acquits not the blasphemer of his guilty lips; Because God is the witness of his inmost self and the sure observer of his heart and the listener to his tongue.
[[Sg 1,7]]For the spirit of the LORD fills the world, is all-embracing, and knows what man says.
first_reading.title: Book of Wisdom
